Posts.Content: May 23, 2017 07:08PM mama2mygirls wrote: I feel so stressed out that I've only had thermograms since turning 40. I really had heard from other people and read that they were a good alternative to mamography in people with very dense breast tissue.
Posts.Title: New here and scared mama2mygirls keepthefaith

Posts.Content: May 25, 2017 08:37PM mama2mygirls wrote: I went for the diagnostic mammogram today. They did it then had me come back for two more pictures and then the ultrasound since you can feel the lump. They said it all looks like fibrocystic/normal breast tissue. They gave me a hand out about breast pain and things to try like reducing caffeine, vitamin E, and Evening Primrose. I only drink water, so caffeine isn't an issue but I guess I can try the rest. It said to try these things for 8-10 weeks. I also got the Thermography report back this afternoon and it says it is fibrocystic too and low risk...I know that doesn't mean much though. But I fee good they agreed I guess. They did ultrasound the lymph nodes that are tender in that arm pit and didn't say anything about those, so I guess that's okay too. She will send the report to my doctor.  Thanks for talking me through!
